thread.title: Amazon Company Brilliance Buys Audio Rights for The Penis Book by Aaron Spitz MD; Published by Rodale Harmony Books and Represented by Agent Alan Morell of CMP

author: cnbc.com
title: Amazon Company Brilliance Buys Audio Rights for The Penis Book by Aaron Spitz MD; Published by Rodale Harmony Books and Represented by Agent Alan Morell of CMP
text:
Int. Rights Sold to Italy, Hungary, Czech, Slovak, Turkey and Dutch Editions and Featured in Oscar Winning Director James Cameron’s New Film “The Game Changers”
BEVERLY HILLS, CA, March 06, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Announced today, Amazon company Brilliance Publishing buys Audio Rights, for “The Penis Book” by Aaron Spitz MD, published by Rodale and Harmony Books: Penguin Random House released Valentines Day 2018 ; International rights sold to Italy, Hungary, Czech, Slovak, Turkey and Dutch editions, represented by Agent Alan Morell, Creative Management Partners (CMP) Beverly Hills, CA.
Aaron Spitz MD, nationally recognized expert in the treatment of infertility, sexual dysfunction, and hormone replacement in the male has appeared in over 40 segments on CBS "The Doctors”.
Said Aaron Spitz MD: "I am very excited about my book with Rodale and Harmony Books U.S. release Valentines Day , as well as our International Sales and Audio Sales to Amazon Brilliance Audio Publishing. My uberAgent Alan Morell actually sold my book 9 months to the very day he said he would and orchestrated these various opportunities for me. We believe our extended Licensing Product lines and on-going Broadcast appearances on CBS “The Doctors” will support “The Penis Book” for a national audience.”
Said Agent Alan Morell of Creative Management Partners (CMP) Beverly Hills: "Dr. Aaron Spitz has done a spectacular job on this ground breaking book “The Penis Book” published by Rodale and Harmony Books in treatment of infertility and sexual dysfunction nationally acclaimed. Dr. Spitz continues to co-host segments on CBS “The Doctors," complimented by “The Penis Book” featured prominently in Oscar Winning Executive Producer James Cameron new film “The Game Changers” spotlighted at this years Sundance Film Festival. This is a reaffirmation that Dr. Spitz continues to be the recognized expert in his field. I am honored to have Aaron as a client and excited about our future."
ABOUT AARON SPITZ MD:
Dr. Spitz earned his Bachelors degree with distinction in all subjects from Cornell University. He earned his medical degree from Cornell Medical College and he completed his Urology residency at the University of Southern California where he was inducted into the Alpha Omega Alpha honor society. He completed a fellowship in male reproductive medicine and surgery at the Baylor College of Medicine. Dr. Spitz is a nationally recognized expert in the treatment of infertility, sexual dysfunction, and hormone replacement in the male. Dr Spitz has lectured to national audiences on these topics as well as written chapters and articles for the scientific press. He is routinely called upon by the lay press and media to explain these complex topics to a general audience.
Dr. Spitz currently directs the Center for Male Reproductive Medicine and Surgery at Orange County Urology in Orange County, California. He is actively engaged in clinical trials and research in the area of Andrology, male sexual dysfunction, and male infertility.
In addition to his private practice partnership, Dr. Aaron Spitz is an assistant clinical professor in the U.C. Irvine department of Urology, specializing in male reproductive medicine and surgery. He provides training to the medical students and residents and he directs a fellowship in male reproductive medicine and surgery.
Dr. Spitz serves as the treasurer of the Society for the Study of Male Reproduction. He is the President of the California Urologic Association. He is the Orange County District representative to the Western Section of the American Urologic Association. He is the lead delegate to the American Medial Association House of Delegates representing the American Urologic Association. He sits on the Health Policy Council of the American Urologic Association. As part of the workforce workgroup, Dr. Spitz is tackling the issue of workforce shortages for doctors and access challenges for patients through the development of telemedicine at a local and national level.
Dr. Spitz also serves as the Medical Director for Fertility Center of California and for Manhattan Cryobank, both comprehensive andrology testing facilities. Dr. Spitz has served as faculty for the American Urological Association's national microsurgical course. Dr. Spitz is a member of the AUA, AMA, SSMR, SMRU, ASRM, PCRS. He serves as a reviewer for the Journal of Endourology and the Journal of Andrology.
